question: A museum near your home is looking for people to do part-time voluntary unpaid work. You would like to do some voluntary/unpaid work at the museum. Write a letter to the museum director to apply for the voluntary/unpaid work. Explain why you want to do voluntary/unpaid work at the museum, describe some skills and qualities you have that would be useful, give details of when you would available for work.
text: I am writing to express my interest in applying as an assistant tour guide for the museum. I recently saw your advertisement in the newspaper that you are looking for part-time volunteers in assisting groups of students who are attending the museum for their annual school field trip.

I have visited the museum countless times, and I am interested because I have always been fascinated with the collection of fossils and artefacts inside the exhibition. Additionally, I also did a dissertation about them. Therefore, I strongly believe in my knowledge and my passion for palaeontology. I am able to help the students to be able to understand the history of life on earth based on fossils.

Currently, I am a student attending Middlesex University,  and my timetable is flexible enough for me to do part-time work. I am available Friday afternoon, and during the weekends, if that is applicable to you.
I look forward to hearing from you.
